results.title: Sanjuro
results.brief_description: Toshiro Mifune swaggers and snarls to brilliant comic effect in Kurosawa’s tightly paced, beautifully composed “Sanjuro.” In this companion piece and sequel to “Yojimbo,” jaded samurai Sanjuro helps an idealistic group of young warriors weed out their clan’s evil influences, and in the process turns their image of a proper samurai on its ear.

constellations_other.name: Blood, shot
constellations_other.description: The fake blood used by costume designer Edie Kurzer in Judy & Punch is connected to a long, bloody lineage in cinema.

results.description: Toshiro Mifune swaggers and snarls to brilliant comic effect in Kurosawa’s tightly paced, beautifully composed “Sanjuro.” In this companion piece and sequel to “Yojimbo,” jaded samurai Sanjuro helps an idealistic group of young warriors weed out their clan’s evil influences, and in the process turns their image of a proper samurai on its ear.

results.title: Sandy Powell’s costume designs
results.brief_description: Costume designer Sandy Powell begins her design process with the script, and then consults with directors on how they envision the characters. Next step is choosing fabrics – one of the most important parts of her process because it inspires the costumes.

constellations_primary.name: Sandy, Swinton, Shakespeare and Derek
constellations_primary.description: Tracing costume designer Sandy Powell's ongoing connections with Tilda Swinton, William Shakespeare and Derek Jarman.

results.description:
Costume designer Sandy Powell begins her design process with the script. Once she knows the story, she consults with directors on how they envision the characters. Then she fills books – divided into chapters on each character – with research images before she sources fabric. Choosing the kinds of fabric she will use is one of the most important parts of Powell’s process – the fabric gives her the idea for her costumes.    

In The Favourite (2018), Powell uses historically accurate silhouettes but modern materials like second-hand denim, fake leather and vinyl. While you might think costume designers always sketch their designs first, many don’t, including Powell, who dives straight into creating the costumes. She only makes the sketches after she knows what the costumes look like and the actors have tested them.
description_for_label:
Costume designer Sandy Powell begins her design process with the script. Once she knows the story, she consults with directors on how they envision the characters. Then she fills books – divided into chapters on each character – with research images before she sources fabric. Choosing the kinds of fabric she will use is one of the most important parts of Powell’s process – the fabric gives her the idea for her costumes.    

In The Favourite (2018), Powell uses historically accurate silhouettes but modern materials like second-hand denim, fake leather and vinyl. While you might think costume designers always sketch their designs first, many don’t, including Powell, who dives straight into creating the costumes. She only makes the sketches after she knows what the costumes look like and the actors have tested them.

results.title: Sands of time
results.brief_description: This natural history documentary looks at Fraser Island, the world’s largest sand island and the only known one on which a significant rain forest exists. The geology of sand dune formation and dune movement, and the creation of the island’s freshwater lakes are clearly explained. The program looks at the ecological balance of the native plants and wildflowers and the introduced animals such as dingoes and brumbies as well as the growing pressures placed on the island from recreational fishing and tourism.

results.title: Sanding and finishing hardwood floors
results.brief_description: This do-it-yourself video guides the beginner on how to sand and finish hardwood floors. It will instruct you on preparing an old or new floor, loading and operating sanders and buffers, and correcting mistakes that may occur. It will also advise you on selecting a finish, filling cracks, appropriate application equipment and health and safety measures.

results.title: Sand paintings of the Western Desert: a demonstration (A)
results.creator_credit: Stephen O'Rourke, Penelope Jools and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Aboriginal artists, Paddy Garrol Tjungarrayi and Dinni Nolan Tjampatimpa, demonstrate the making of a sandpainting - a traditional art form intended to be impermanent. The paintings are made in a ritual manner and then destroyed as they are danced upon during a corroboree. Shows the adaptation of western technology by the Papunya people to this traditional art form.

results.title: Sand casting: an art adventure
results.creator_credit: Bill Mackie, Easy Street Productions and Centron Films
results.brief_description: Shows a young woman and several children making sand casts of several objects. The adult demonstrator shows the step by step procedure for making and decorating plaster of paris castings using inexpensive materials. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Sand and flame
results.brief_description: Open with a survey of the development of glass-making and the art of the early glass-blower. Shows manufacture of wide range of glass products, including the automatic bottle-making process; manufacture of fine glass tubing; transformation of glass marbles into glass fibre; production of glass bricks; furnacing, rolling, cutting, grinding and polishing of plate glass; manufacture of shatter-proof plate glass.
